name: GetListTasks
description:
Retrieve tasks from a specific list in ClickUp.

This tool retrieves tasks from a specified list in ClickUp, limited to 100 tasks per page. It includes tasks where the specified list is their home, while also allowing inclusion of tasks from multiple lists by using the `include_timl` parameter. It provides details accessible to the user, including time spent on tasks with time entries.

parameters.name: list_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the list. Find it by copying the link and extracting the number following /li in the URL.

value_schema.description: To find the list_id: \ 1. In the Sidebar, hover over the List and click the **ellipsis ...** menu. \ 2. Select **Copy link.** \ 3. Use the copied URL to find the list_id. The list_id is the number that follows /li in the URL.

parameters.name: page_number_to_fetch
parameters.description: Specify the page number to fetch tasks from, starting at 0.

value_schema.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).

parameters.name: order_by_field
parameters.description: Specify the field to order tasks by. Options: 'id', 'created', 'updated', 'due_date'. Defaults to 'created'.

value_schema.description:
Order by a particular field. By default, tasks are ordered by `created`.\
 \
Options include: `id`, `created`, `updated`, and `due_date`.

parameters.name: filter_by_statuses
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their statuses. Use an array of status strings, such as ['to do', 'in progress'].

value_schema.description:
Filter by statuses. To include closed tasks, use the `include_closed` parameter. \
 \
For example: \
 \
`?statuses[]=to%20do&statuses[]=in%20progress`

parameters.name: filter_by_assignees
parameters.description: Filter tasks by assignee IDs. Provide an array of assignee IDs to filter tasks assigned to specific users.

value_schema.description:
Filter by Assignees. For example: \
 \
`?assignees[]=1234&assignees[]=5678`

parameters.name: filter_by_watchers
parameters.description: An array of watcher IDs to filter tasks by watchers. Each ID should be a string.

value_schema.description: Filter by watchers.

parameters.name: filter_by_tags
parameters.description: Filter tasks by a list of tags. Provide an array of strings representing the tags to filter by.

value_schema.description:
Filter by tags. For example: \
 \
`?tags[]=tag1&tags[]=this%20tag`

parameters.name: filter_due_date_greater_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks by a due date greater than the provided Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by due date greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_due_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks with due dates earlier than the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by due date less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_date_created_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks created after this Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date created greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_created_less_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks created before the specified Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date created less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_date_updated_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks updated after the specified Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date updated greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_date_updated_less_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks updated before a specific date, using Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date updated less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_date_done_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks completed after a specified date in Unix time (milliseconds).

value_schema.description: Filter by date done greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_date_done_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks completed before a specified Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date done less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_custom_fields
parameters.description: Include tasks with specific values in one or more Custom Fields. Use a JSON array of objects, where each object includes 'field_id', 'operator', and 'value'.

value_schema.description:
Include tasks with specific values in one or more Custom Fields. Custom Relationships are included.\
 \
For example: `?custom_fields=[{"field_id":"abcdefghi12345678","operator":"=","value":"1234"},{"field_id":"jklmnop123456","operator":"<","value":"5"}]`\
 \
Only set Custom Field values display in the `value` property of the `custom_fields` parameter. If you want to include tasks with specific values in only one Custom Field, use `custom_field` instead.\
 \
Learn more about [filtering using Custom Fields.](doc:taskfilters)

parameters.name: filter_by_custom_field
parameters.description: Include tasks with specific values in one Custom Field. This can be a Custom Relationship. Provide an array of strings representing the field values.

value_schema.description: Include tasks with specific values in only one Custom Field. This Custom Field can be a Custom Relationship.

parameters.name: custom_task_type_filters
parameters.description: An array of numbers to filter tasks by custom types. Use 0 for tasks, 1 for Milestones, and other numbers for custom types defined in your Workspace.

value_schema.description:
Filter by custom task types. For example: \
 \
`?custom_items[]=0&custom_items[]=1300` \
 \
Including `0` returns tasks. Including `1` returns Milestones. Including any other number returns the custom task type as defined in your Workspace.

parameters.name: include_archived_tasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include archived tasks in the results. By default, archived tasks are excluded.

parameters.name: include_markdown_task_descriptions
parameters.description: Set to true to return task descriptions in Markdown format.

value_schema.description: To return task descriptions in Markdown format, use `?include_markdown_description=true`.

parameters.name: display_tasks_in_reverse_order
parameters.description: Set to true to display tasks in reverse order.

value_schema.description: Tasks are displayed in reverse order.

parameters.name: include_subtasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include subtasks; false to exclude them. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description: Include or exclude subtasks. By default, subtasks are excluded.

parameters.name: include_closed_tasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include closed tasks in the response. Defaults to false to exclude them.

value_schema.description:
Include or excluse closed tasks. By default, they are excluded.\
 \
To include closed tasks, use `include_closed: true`.

parameters.name: include_tasks_in_multiple_lists
parameters.description: Set to true to include tasks that exist in multiple lists. By default, these tasks are excluded.

value_schema.description:
Include Tasks in Multiple Lists. By default, tasks that exist in multiple lists are excluded from the response.\
 \
To include tasks that exist in multiple lists, use `include_timl: true`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: include_markdown_description
parameters.description: To return task descriptions in Markdown format, use `?include_markdown_description=true`.

value_schema.description: To return task descriptions in Markdown format, use `?include_markdown_description=true`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).

value_schema.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
Order by a particular field. By default, tasks are ordered by `created`.\
 \
Options include: `id`, `created`, `updated`, and `due_date`.

 \
Options include: `id`, `created`, `updated`, and `due_date`.

For example: \

parameters.name: include_closed
parameters.description:
Include or excluse closed tasks. By default, they are excluded.\
 \
To include closed tasks, use `include_closed: true`.

value_schema.description:
Include or excluse closed tasks. By default, they are excluded.\
 \
To include closed tasks, use `include_closed: true`.

parameters.name: include_timl
parameters.description:
Include Tasks in Multiple Lists. By default, tasks that exist in multiple lists are excluded from the response.\
 \
To include tasks that exist in multiple lists, use `include_timl: true`.

value_schema.description:
Include Tasks in Multiple Lists. By default, tasks that exist in multiple lists are excluded from the response.\
 \
To include tasks that exist in multiple lists, use `include_timl: true`.
